newsitem.title: USA: Osmonics shareholders to offer less shares.
newsitem.headline: Osmonics shareholders to offer less shares.

text.p: Osmonics Inc said Monday it filed an amended registration with the Securities and Exchange Commission that some stockholders will sell up to 582,806 common shares instead of 627,500 common announced on Oct 9.
The shareholders granted underwriters a 30-day over-allotment option of up 72,610 additional common shares, the filing said. The offering will be made through Cleary Gull Reiland & McDevitt Inc.
After the offering, outstanding shares will total 14,184,091 common, the filing said.
Selling shareholders include Charles Palmer, a director of the company; Donald Bray, who was not identified, and the directors and executive officers as a group.
Osmonics Inc of Minnetonka, Minn., is a provider of water purification and filtration equipment and components to industrial and commercial end-users.
